choiceresponse.p: Which two approaches can be used with both the XADD and XTRIM commands to control a stream’s growth?
choiceresponse.label: Choose two answers:

checkboxgroup.choice: Trimming the stream to a specific byte size
Trimming the stream to remove entries that have a given key in their name/value pairs payload
Trimming the stream to an exact number of messages
Trimming the stream to an approximate number of messages

div.p: Both XADD and XTRIM provide the ability to trim a stream’s length to either an exact or an approximate number of entries. Capping to an approximate number using MAXLEN and the tilde modifier is the most efficient and recommended way to do this.
Trimming a stream to a specific byte size or depending on the content of the message payload are not currently supported by Redis Streams.
